website_summaries.verdict: With its built-in solar-powered battery, the sleek Logitech Wireless Solar Keyboard K760 will save you money in the long run and is a better deal than Apple's Bluetooth Wireless Keyboard.
pros: The Logitech Wireless Solar Keyboard K760 has a sleek and stylish design that complements Apple products
An integrated solar panel can charge the keyboard from any light source (including a lamp), so there's no need to replace batteries
And the K760 can pair with three devices (such as Mac, iPad, iPhone) and switch among them at the touch of a button
cons: Though it's fairly compact, it's a little bulky to carry around with you and no protective carrying case is provided

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Pricey - But Well Worth It!!!
customer_reviews.text: I broke my other keyboard like this one and I decided to go out on a limb and purchase another one before its too late to find a keyboard that still has enough traction to depress buttons. These other keyboards out here are just awful. In fact, when I purchased a new Mac Book Air laptop, I could not believe that the keys are so thin it's almost like typing directly on a flat surface. So, this keyboard makes computing all the better because it's easier for me to depress keys and it has a very comfortable touch and feel. If you're looking for a nice keyboard, that helps you to type fast, this is the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Caveat Emptor Its Overpricd
customer_reviews.text: Search around the internet. There are other reputable firms selling this for less. The price here is a rip off. Totally. My keyboard cap light does not turn on (keyboard is a week old). Sometimes soething really horrible happens, which is that it starts deleting text at a rapid pace. I have to hit several keys to stop this. By then I could have lost several sentences.
customer_reviews.author: Product Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: goes sleep and is slow waking up.
customer_reviews.text: It's great keyboard with some great features. But, when you are not typing, it goes to sleep. Then when you start typing it does not capture the first few characters that you typed in... then you have to re-enter your text. The wireless apple keyboard goes to sleep as well, but it captures all input as it reconnects to the computer. I keep this as a spare keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Richards

customer_reviews.title: This is the right keyboard, but mine was the European key layout
customer_reviews.text: I got the European keyboard layout version. It doesn't match the pictures, nor the description. I am frankly surprised since this is a major oversight. It isn't backlit, which I knew going in, but it asked me to rate it in low light situations. It can pair with multiple devices such as iPhone and iPad to allow for a single keyboard to be used with all your wireless devices. That is awesome, and the reason I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Brownlee

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly been a year ... It working perfectly till last week .Suddenly it stopped working .Three bluetooth pairing lights wouldn't come up .. This unit is great .But for the money ..We would expect a longer life span ...
customer_reviews.author: Dhyan

customer_reviews.title: Very good keyboard with minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Works great and does not need battery changes. On my Older Mac Pro though, it does not always wake up the computer. F1 light flashes but the screen stays black until a power button on the computer is pressed. It does not happen always. Could be Bluetooth issue. Another feature that may need tweaking by the manufacturer is the caps lock. It lights up as on Apple keyboards when the caps are activated and briefly shows a capped A on the monitor. Then the light goes off unlike on an Apple keyboard. Depressing it again shows the crossed A (caps off). A constant light when caps are on would be much better like on standard keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander V. Ljubimov

customer_reviews.title: Wife Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Logitech makes good product. Keep in mind this is still a value based keyboard, it is not made from Apple sculpted aluminum. I had the apple wireless keyboard along with the wireless track pad for my wife's 2012 i-Mac. She hated the Apple "high end" set up. Saw this thing, knew LogiTech would be a "step down" but ordered it anyway. Turns out the keyboard is indeed plastic, but it looks fine and works well. I would argue the keyboard feel equals the Apple keyboard's excellent spring back. The Solar panel really does work. The keyboard so far has had no bluetooth interface problems and due to the larger footprint the keys are properly spaced. Happy wife. Happy life.
customer_reviews.author: Bay Area Denizen

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has done everything as advertised. I really like it. I can type fast, the keys are quiet and respond perfectly. It supports multiple devices just like advertised. Really happy with this keyboard. If I had any negative thing to say about it, when I am typing really fast and I hit the shift key to type a capital letter, many times the next letter I type is input as a cap as well. THat can be a little frustrating because it happens a lot. I have adjusted with an ever-so slight pause after typing a capital letter (hey, it could be me). Other than that, this is a great product. Love never having to put batteries in!!!
customer_reviews.author: GLAP

customer_reviews.title: Less Money than the Mac Keyboard, Switches Between devices and no Batteries Required
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. Works just like a Mac Bluetooth Keyboard. Plus it switches nicely between my iPad, my Macbook and a 3rd device (if needed). My OEM Mac Bluetooth keyboard sat for a few months and the battery corrosion made it unusable. I could not even open the battery cover, the leaking battery / corrosion was so bad. Perhaps I just got some bad batteries, but seemed like an unusually bad design from Mac -- reading about several other customers that had the same problem in the forums. And Apple's response is "too bad." This keyboard avoids all that with solar power. I've only had it 2 months but it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly gaming mechanical keyboard quality, but certainly awesome, and very reliable. It holds a charge for a long time and doesn't seem to ever really need charging unless I store it in a dark place with the power on. I do wish it allowed for wired charging to make it faster, but that might also shorten the battery life. It connects to 3 devices at once, it is easy to pair. It is modeled after the Macbook keyboard design. And unlike my spouse, it doesn't tell me to sleep on the couch if I push its' buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Remrie Arrie

customer_reviews.title: A very useful, versatile and comfortable wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Here is a light Apple-type keyboard that makes typing on a mobile device a lot easier. There are 3 “hot-keys” for quickly changing from one device to another, it charges itself with lamplight or sunlight, indoors or outdoors, will run for 3 months on a single charge, is easy to set-up and use, and its concave key design delivers fast, quiet typing, with more precision than your iPad or iPhone on-screen keyboard. You can even use it on AppleTV! I can slip this keyboard in my portfolio case with my iPad and can type or email anywhere without having to bring a laptop. Pros: Works well, very comfortable. Cons: It should include a case to protect it in transit.
customer_reviews.author: William Dubovsky

customer_reviews.title: Grat for the Mac mini and always charged... fantastic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The solar works very well. It's small, light, and never has connection issues. I use it with my Mac mini and my Samsung tablet. That's the nice feature that you have three bluetooth channels to use with this device. The solar keeps it charged all the time and I have never had any issues with typing or interpretation of commands. I would buy this keyboard again and am hoping the rest of my family will, as well, because I've not had a better keyboard. A larger model may be nice but I think there may be one available. This is absolutely fantastic for any Mac user.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the Apple version
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nicely made Logitech product, with build and styling on par with Apple products. It is more versatile than the Apple wireless keyboard in that it will save Bluetooth pairing handshake profiles with 3 different hosts, and can switch between them instantly by pressing one button. So far I've paired it with 2 devices and been able to switch between a Mac mini and an iPad2 without any trouble. It's also greener/more thrifty than the Apple wireless keyboard because you don't have to buy and ultimately dispose of AA batteries anymore. This unit has so far exceeded expectations, great recommendation from a friend in San Diego.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyFresh

customer_reviews.title: Works great, even in low light
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a couple of weeks now and it works great. Typing is quick and it is quick to re-sync when the computer comes out of sleep. I have even used this in extremely low light and not had a problem. I am using a 2011 macbook pro with this keyboard. Extremely easy setup. There is a small glitch when I try to hook up my blue-tooth speaker and this keyboard but, I feel that's a bluetooth issue and not an issue with this product. The bluetooth speaker cuts in and out but again, I do not fault the keyboard. Just know that you probably can't utilize a bluetooth speaker with another active bluetooth device like this.
customer_reviews.author: K F

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, supports multiple devices!
customer_reviews.text: I'm going from a wired Apple keyboard (with the chiclet keys) to this keyboard. There is a difference in feel when it comes to the key action. This seems to have a bit more travel than the Apple keyboard. Typing on it is just as easy though. The solar charging is pretty cool, although I have not owned it long enough to see if I ever encounter a low charge situation. A couple of huge pluses: - Supports up to 3 bluetooth devices - Syncs quickly over bluetooth (some keyboards I've used were unbearably slow) - Solar charging! Overall, I'm happy with the quality and functionality of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: masterhankshake

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not an apple product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an imac running os 10.6. The bluetooth switching feature is awesome and the solar works well. It feels well made and solid and it's easy to type with. My only complaint is most of the time when I turn the cpu on from even a brief break, a keyboard setup window pops up. I don't actually have to do the setup - just close the window, but it's annoying. It also doesn't show up for the keyboard settings on the system preferences menu. It works, but the mac doesn't treat it as equivalent to apple's own keyboards. The solar and the device switching make it all worth it, though.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: The solar works perfectly, the typing leaves a bit to be desired
customer_reviews.text: Here is what people want to know: yes the solar works. The typing is decent but not as nice as the regular Apple Keyboard. The source select is awesome for switching from iMac to iPad too. No direct sunlight just running off very small ambient light. I have noticed that my typing quality has gone down due to the new keys. I will just adapt but there where times where I hit the key and nothing happened. Here is an example: The quick bown fox jumpe oer the lay dog Not that big of deal if you always screw typing anyway. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Works great, connects quickly, stays charged, keys feel a bit cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with this keyboard, one touch switching between three different bluetooth devices. This allows me two keep one handy keyboard for my work computer, home computer and tablet, and switching between them is just a quick tap on a function key. Connects quickly and reliably too. The device stays charged with no effort, which is a godsend after using the battery-sucking Apple keyboard. The only complaint I have is the actual keys -- they articulate reliably, but make a thin plastic-y sound when pressed. A slightly heavier material on the key would make the typing experience a lot more pleasant, and quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Delgaudio

customer_reviews.title: Great device, light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I needed a keyboard for my iPad, but this went far beyond that. I use it for my Note 2 phone, my Galaxy 10.1 2014 tablet, my iPad, iPod, PC, and my Blackberry Playbook, and all have worked perfectly. It lets you store 3 profiles so that you can switch quickly between three devices, but if you need to change to others you can do so easily. I have no way to check the battery because you need a Mac for that (unfortunately) but otherwise it's great. Update: It's been 2 years since I bought it, and it still works perfectly. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Love this device for my iPhone, iPad and MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: This is just great. It is easy to pair to your various devices and to change the pairing as necessary. And once you have three devices set up (iPhone, iPad, MacBook for me), you can one-touch switch between which device the keyboard will control. Never had a problem pairing once set up. The solar panel seems to work - I've never hard any problems with the device not working, it is always charged. Having a keyboard to use with your iPhone on occasion will change the way you use the phone - just makes doing a few things much easier. Really glad to have this on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob A. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, but kept dropping connection
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to keep this keyboard and use it on every Apple product I have, but I ultimately returned it because it kept dropping a connection to my iMac. Bluetooth just seems to be a little unreliable, at least when purchasing non-Apple products, so I'm going to just go with a wired keyboard. That being said, if the connectivity doesn't bother you, then you'll find a really ingenious keyboard that stays charged and has an amazing feel. To tell you the truth, I really wish that Apple would build their keyboards like this one because it surpassed the look and feel of the stock Apple keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: J.W. McGhee

customer_reviews.title: 3rd time's the charm?
customer_reviews.text: it gets 4 stars, because it's a nice keyboard. A bit loud, sure, also has a nice price point these days. However This is my 3rd one.... One the battery just quit working... the second I left outside trying to charge it.. it got wet during a rian storm.. never to work again. I will say this, When the first one quick working, Logitech replaced that puppy no questions asked. New one to my door in a few days, dare I say they approached Apple awesome customer service. Over all it works, nice, just make sure you have some light hitting it.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Himmelberger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, reasonable price. Great design!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard. I have used the Apple version before, and this is every bit as good. And it can connect to 3 different devices (Laptop, iPhone, iPad, bring it on). The built is solar panel seems to do its job, I don't even turn it off. By the way, this keyboard "goes to sleep" to save batteries when it's not in use for a while (a minute or 2 it seems). So don't be surprised if the characters don't show up immediately on your screen when you start using it again. Fortunately no character is lost, the keyboard just buffers them and catches up in no time.
customer_reviews.author: ec92009

customer_reviews.title: Fair trade off
customer_reviews.text: No problem pairing with older Mac tower, which can be picky at times. I like the key action, good for me. But above all no more charging. Works fine for me, bit of a hesitation when you start typing before it pairs, but a fair trade off for the convenience, I can get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding replacement for a stock apple wireless keyboard that would run thru batteries regularly. out of the box the bluetooth pairing was easy with my mac desktop. this works well even though I keep it in a closed drawer most of the time. even with just the light in the room when the keyboard is out, the keyboard always connects quickly and works flawlessly. I am actually making money not putting 3 sets of batteries a month into this board. works great and highly recommend it as a replacement keyboard for an iMac.
customer_reviews.author: mikedfe

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard and No Batteries
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2012 iMac. Initially I had problems with the keyboard taking a while (30 secs) to connect and then disconnecting randomly. However my mouse had the same problem so I suspected and read forums suggesting it was the iMac. Now since the recent Mavericks update the keyboard connects very quickly and doesn't seem to disconnect. The keyboard feels great and I have never had problems with the solar battery system. Plus the price on this keyboard is better than most.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Merrick

customer_reviews.title: Better than Apple's keyboard--Never needs batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an Apple wireless keyboard with this keyboard and have been very happy with the results: -No more batteries to change. It was particularly inconvenient to change the batteries on the Apple keyboard because it requires a penny or a flathead screw driver to open the battery compartment and always seemed to need changing at the most inopportune times. -It is convenient to be able to switch pairing between the keyboard and a computer or an iphone at the press of a button, especially when responding to a long email or text message.
customer_reviews.author: boss_crab

customer_reviews.title: Great for my iPad
customer_reviews.text: My work laptop was going in for a scheduled upgrade and I would need to be able to do my emails for about 3 days via my iPad. I needed a keyboard since typing on an iPad's screen can be tiresome. I found this keyboard and one of the great features is that it is solar powered. It works great only in indoor lighting and the keys have a very high quality feel about them. The keyboard overall is compact but easy to type on (not too narrow). I use it constantly now when I use my iPad. Another great product from Logitech
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Never worry about batteries ever again!
customer_reviews.text: Feels better than the apple wireless mini keyboard, good clicky feeling in the keys, and about the same dimensions as the apple keyboard. Just a little taller because of the solar panel. I would highly recommend this, or the version with the num pad if you need it. No delay in connecting, although sometimes the device will disconnect after not being used for a while, but this was typical with the apple keyboard as well. More likely a bluetooth thing. Get this and never worry about batteries ever again.
customer_reviews.author: dotcommer

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Over Apple
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Works great, doesn't need any batteries or a plug. Its low maintenance and really is just great to use. I was between this and Apple's bluetooth keyboard. I went for this one and boy am I happy with my choice. Only issue I've had was the "A" key got stuck after four months of daily use, I called Logitech customer service and they were ready to send a replacement when the key got unstuck. I don't think it is a big deal because Logitech worked with me to fix it and were going to make things right if they didn't. I highly recommend this product as an alternative to Apple's Bluetooth keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Masro002

customer_reviews.title: Small and Convenient - No batteries to worry about, either!
customer_reviews.text: This is really a nice keyboard to speed type upon. Key combinations make up for the larger "air-craft carrier" keyboard with the number pad. The best feature for me - it easily links to three different Mac products with ease. No batteries, because the solar panel supplies as needed. And no USB modules needed for this particular model. I have owned the larger version of this for Windows PC keyboard arrangement - nearly three years and doing quite well. Both Logitech keyboards have the same high quality.
customer_reviews.author: UT

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. Easy to use, easy to charge, no more batteries needed. Could not be happier. I am also thrilled with how it works with all my apple devices (iPad, iPhone & mac mini). It is easy to move between each, literally as easy as pressing a button. There are 3 buttons on the key board specifically for bluetooth connection to 3 devices, once you setup the button for each device all you have to do is press that key and it automatically connects. I move between devices easily, quick connect/disconnect. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: SuzeQ

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard with one major flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I love the look, feel, and convenience of this keyboard, but..... It seems that every time my macbook goes to sleep and wakes up to a password screen, this Logitech keyboard can't connect via bluetooth. I need to enter my password directly on my Macbook (not easy since it's tucked under the monitor stand, then the keyboard will connect. Not sure why this is since my Apple magic mouse will connect regardless if it's before or after the password is entered. Other than that minor annoyance, I feel like this was a worthy purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cousin Eddie

customer_reviews.title: I had taken a Square Trade policy on this product but since it broke within the warranty period I had to deal with Logitech cust
customer_reviews.text: This worked for a couple of months then stopped....I would type and different symbols would appear! I had taken a Square Trade policy on this product but since it broke within the warranty period I had to deal with Logitech customer service reps who were very bad tempered to get it replaced. I will never by a Logitech product again.
customer_reviews.author: iluvcats

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Been using this thing for about a month. It has now replaced the Apple keyboard permanently. Though the apple keyboard has a slightly nicer feel because it's made of aluminum, this thing way more features. The solar works great, every time I check the battery level it's at 100% and the only source of light is just from the regular ceiling lights. I currently have it connected via blu tooth to my iMac, MacBook Pro and iPad. Switching between devices is as easy as pressing F1 F2 or F3. Super easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up- Noisy typing
customer_reviews.text: The blue tooth and ability to swap between devices is fantastic. It was quick and easy to pair. However, the keys are extremely noisy and a little loose. It has the sound of an oldschool GuessWho board. Even lightly touching the keys makes noise. It's not super pleasant to type on and isn't particularly portable. I don't find myself using it very much because of how very noisy it is.
customer_reviews.author: thelse

customer_reviews.title: One keyboard to rule them all!!
customer_reviews.text: The great thing about this keyboard is that it can be paired with three Apple devices at once, and with the solar cells, no batteries. It uses the Apple layout, so not good for a Windows computer. IT works as expected, nothing else really to say. Kinda seems odd that someone didn't come up with the idea earlier of switching between devices with a keystroke. Not reinventing the Apple keyboard layout is very nice, everything is where it is supposed to be. My only ding against the keyboard is that it doesn't have the same aluminum finish that the genuine apple keyboard does have.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wilmath

customer_reviews.title: This is the keyboard you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth - check Toggle between multiple devices - check Solar (no batteries to charge!) - check Good looks (that match the Apple aesthetic) - check If you're looking for a solar Bluetooth keyboard, there aren't a lot of great options - thankfully this one is fantastic. Power performance is good. Keyboard feel is good (very much like the 'chicklet' style keyboards made by Apple).
customer_reviews.author: Jordan B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Nice little keyboard, quality construction, feels good to type on, never had it run low on charge. It's nice that it remembers 3 devices that it has been linked with and you can switch between them with the touch of a button. My only complaint is that it drops the bluetooth connection a couple of times a day and then takes 5 or 10 seconds to reconnect. Long enough for me to lose my train of thought and cause annoyance. Twenty-first century problem, I know. Don't have that issue with other bluetooth keyboards that I own however.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Renewable Wireless Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I chose 3 stars because it took awhile for the keyboard to pair with my mac. I followed the instructions, but I'd have to re-pair it every time I turned on my computer. It pairs automatically now, but it's not on automatically because it's conserving energy. I never worry about it running out of power, which is good. It does have a power switch, but I don't bother because it has it's own sleep mode. The only thing I would improve on this keyboard is for it to have a power sensor that detects when the computer turns on so that the computer isn't trying to connect to the keyboard above all other functions.
customer_reviews.author: Dudeist

customer_reviews.title: Great bluetooth keyboard with solar charging that really works.
customer_reviews.text: I now have 2 of these and love them. I love the ability of the keyboard to remember 3 different bluetooth devices without having to pair the devices when changing devices all the time. Note that it also works with the Apple TV. Mine is paired with an Apple TV (3rd gen), an iPad Air 2 (replaced an iPad 4) and my wife's iPad Air (replaced an iPad 2). My wife has the second keyboard and has it paired with her iPad and two Apple TV's.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C. White Jr.

customer_reviews.title: There is nothing better than a solar keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: No batteries to buy, no cords needed to charge this keyboard. It's easy to carry, light weight, and easy to type on. I carry this with my iPad to class, and use this to take notes when I need to write down a lot of information. The keys are so easy to type on, and the bluetooth connection is fast and easy to set up. I highly recommend this to anyone who is thinking about getting a bluetooth keyboard. It's SO much cheaper and easier to use than the Apple key board. Definitely my top pick.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard for Multiple Devices ... and it's Solar!
customer_reviews.text: I can't think of anything bad to say about this keyboard. It just works, it supports up to 3 devices, and works with Bluetooth. I use it with two MacBooks and an iPad and it works beautifully. It's sized large enough so that the keys are far apart allowing me to type easily, but it's small and light enough to not be bulky. I can't say much about the solar aspect except that it just works, no need for batteries. Overall this keyboard proved to be far more useful than i'd imagined. Great product from Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: MisterStorm

customer_reviews.title: Worked amazingly well for 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 3 months and then randomly started glitching -- Every key I pressed would perform random actions or type random letters. Other external keyboards I used didn't have this issue. I attempted to "reset" the keyboard multiple times by removing history of it from my laptop and reconnecting, but the issue persisted. Amazon fortunately gave me a full refund from the initial purchase date.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: logitech vs apple external keyboard
customer_reviews.text: been using the logitech keyboard for sixth months. i like the logitech and apple external keyboard, but logitech has been better: .. in some locations, press key on apple external keyboard, nothing happens. same location, use logitech, all taps make it to the computer (replaced batteries in apple external keyboard, did not make a difference) .. battery has not run out on the logitech, nor been replaced (solar keyboard that does not need much sun)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK, but loses connection too easily
customer_reviews.text: Decent replacement for Apple keyboard. I like the solar charging option, as it saves time/money replacing batteries. My big complaint is that it seems to lose its bluetooth connection a bit too quickly if left unattended. So if you are reading a long article, it might disconnect and have to reconnect/wake up when you use it again. Not a fatal flaw, but the Apple wireless keyboard doesn't do this. Otherwise it may be a bit more rugged than the apple one too.
customer_reviews.author: Expatcalifornian

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to get rid of my bulky Microsoft keyboard, about half the length and three times smaller. They keys feel great, theyre not too soft and theyre not too stiff almost perfect. I was able to sync it with my mac without and issue. The only thing i do wish this keyboard had was the ability to change the song, (Next or Back buttons) Other than that this keyboard is great. A great bonus is that it does not require batteries, I am running it on the light of my macbook pros screen alone as I type. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: Great BT Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My main objection to wireless keyboards has been the need to replace the batteries far too frequently. The solar charger on this keyboard seems to solve that issue. I have used it with my Apple TV and my iPhone (just to see how it would do). The keys have a nice feel when typing. It connects from across the room with the ATV and makes searches a breeze. Having three memories for Bluetooth devices is great, and I hope that my wife can easily use it with her iPad Air that she is getting for Christmas. One additional positive note: The price on Amazon was far lower than anywhere else I looked.
customer_reviews.author: John Megill

customer_reviews.title: great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard and the fact that it is solar powered. You can easily switch between mac, iphone, and ipad. Keys are a bit noisier than apple keyboard and that would be the only negative side, but some people may like that. I wish that home button works on mac too. Instead it works only on iPhone and iPad. The look and feel of this keyboard is very nice and compares to apple keyboard that I use at home. Key layout is the same as it is on other apple products, iMac, Mac Books, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Bojan Kalajdzic

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for the right Bluetooth keyboard for my iPhone and iPad for years. I've tried other products, including other models by Logitech, and nothing ever felt right. But this one meets my needs perfectly! It's a great keyboard that I can touch-type on comfortably. I can switch between my iPhone and iPad with the touch of a button on the keyboard, and I can add a third device once I have one. The solar charging is convenient, and the entire unit is small enough to transport easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth H. Merchant

customer_reviews.title: I love it I ahve 2 solar key boards form logitech
customer_reviews.text: This is my sencond solar panel key board. My first one used a dongle and is full size. This being a bluetooth I am able to connect 3 Apple devices to it, which I have my Mac Mini, my IPad and IPhone programmed to this keyboard. The solar panel charges very easily and I have never had a problem with the key board staying charged. Being bluetooth I have the ability to reprogram the keyboard to different Apple products that do not have a USB port connection.
customer_reviews.author: mavivalip

customer_reviews.title: works better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: You can set 3 devices to this. It changes from my mac os10.7 to my other mac os10.5 and to my HTC EVO LTE Android smart phone. It does so with no problems at all and takes less than 2 sec to complete the change! When I use it on my phone the shortcut keys even work! play/pause next/back volume and even brightness. It also does that thing where ur phone screen zooms out to reveal all your "windows" like when you pinch the home screen. I had no trouble setting this device up. It was easy.
customer_reviews.author: JPH

customer_reviews.title: power saving feature causes some issues
customer_reviews.text: when you first wake up the keyboard it takes a little bit of time to reconnect. it can be frustrating when you just need to log in to your computer really quickly and have to wait for the keyboard to startup\pair. I have had other keyboards that did not have the same issue. build quality is not as nice as a Apple or Motorola. If you are considering this as a cheaper alternative to one of those I'd spend the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: nj

customer_reviews.title: Little keyboard that could
customer_reviews.text: I was able to buy this at a very good price, so took a chance on it. It’s a wonderful keyboard with a tactile interface that I actually prefer over an Apple keyboard. The ability to pair it with up to three devices is great, and the solar power (I keep mine in a drawer most of the time, and when I use it, it’s being charged by the light of the lamp next to my chair) feature is perfect: no batteries to replace, and the thing is very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: kmariec

customer_reviews.title: Still working even with crack
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I accidentally cracked the solar panel a few years ago and it still works perfectly well. I love that I can just turn it on without worrying if it is sufficiently charged.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I'd buy any brand but Apple. This keyboard has been working better than the Apple wireless keyboard which dropped connection with MacBook and mouse all the time. This looks great, but is not aluminum, it's plastic. But, I haven't had any issues with the quality so far. Pros: Solar powered-lasts a long time with minimal light required Matches other Apple products Strong bluetooth connection, hasn't dropped connection Cons: Caps Lock button doesn't light up when on Plastic (may be cons for some) Keys feel a little different than Apple keyboard that Mac users are used to Overall, good product. Does what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie421

customer_reviews.title: Not using as much as I expected, but still a very good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the keyboard as frequently as I expected that I might with my iPad, but when I have used it, it has worked flawlessly. The best feature, in my opinion, is the solar power to avoid yet another device with batteries. I've had no problems pairing it and the switch allowing pairing with a couple of device is very nice. The feel of the keyboard is good, too.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dale

customer_reviews.title: Good but I overlooked another.
customer_reviews.text: One word, K811, if that can be considered a word. I like this keyboard. I really do. You can attach it to 3 devices. Batteries/Power lasts forever* (until the batteries fail, I assume) but one thing I hate is I didn't see the K811 first. Backlit keyboards, enough said.
customer_reviews.author: franziz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for using with an iPad
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for these for my wife because I got tired of listening to her dictating her e-mails. She loves it. The solar power works well even on the west coast where we don't get much sun in the winter, so she has no worries about batteries going dead. My son uses it occasionally with his iPod Touch if he wants to type a longer message and the feature that allows it to be paired to 3 devices works well.
customer_reviews.author: Kariba

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This wireless keyboard was exactly what I needed! So simple to use, with easy to follow directions. I bought it to use with my iPad mini, for the times I didn’t want to sit at my desk at the computer, but still needed a better keyboard than the touch screen on the iPad. I had no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe Obsessed

customer_reviews.title: I am a first time refurbished item buyer.
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and purchased a refurbished keyboard. It is perfect! I don't see any marks or blemishes on it. I turned it on and it connected right away. I had been looking for an app which tells if a Bluetooth keyboard is fully charged and low and behold, on this one all I do is press a function key and the light tells me it's OK. It's a little heaver than other BT keyboards I have, but I understand that the solar cells add a bit of weight. All in all, I am very pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: our7cats

customer_reviews.title: You'll Love it! Works with iPhone 4 too.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this keyboard and can't find anything that I don't like about it. It worked right out of the box and easily recognized my ipad and iPhone 4. I wasn't sure if the Bluetooth version in the iPhone 4 would work with the Bluetooth version in this keyboard, but it does! I'm a clumsy typist on my tiny iphone's virtual keyboard, so I've used this logitech keyboard for texting on my iPhone while I'm at home. So easy!
customer_reviews.author: AnnN

customer_reviews.title: Died prematurely
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it worked really well. Easy to pair, responds quickly. One day it konked out and refused to pair with any of my devices. Tried all of the trouble shooting methods, including putting it out in the sun to make sure it had a good charge, but it's toast. I'm going to try to get it replaced under warranty, but I'm not holding my breath.
customer_reviews.author: Just another sane, rational Floridian

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Wireless Solar Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I took it out of the box, followed the directions and I was set to go using this keyboard with my iPad. I have two iPads and they both connected without any problem. I am still getting use to having to touch the screen to start the typing on the page - but the keyboard itself is great. You can hear the clicks -- but it takes me back to my typing on a typewriter days -- so isn't a bother for me. I am using it in a low light situation and it is running just fine off what solar it is receiving.
customer_reviews.author: Simple Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Key "A" stopped working after 1,5 years
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard was easy to set up, and the battery charging and connection worked perfectly fine. I have not been to happy with the feel of the keyboard, I thought it would be more like the Apple keyboard but the keys were positioned higher here and made a bigger sound. Anyway, it was useful. However, after 1.5 year of extremely unfrequent use - I used it only in rare occasions - one key stopped functioning, it seems to be a mechanical failure.
customer_reviews.author: tundish

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard works really well with my retina MacBook Pro ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard works really well with my retina MacBook Pro. It holds its charge really well, and I've only very, very rarely had to move it closer to a window for a recharge. The bluetooth connection works flawlessly (there's only a slight delay after a reboot of the computer, and any keys I press in the meantime are buffered) - although this was not the case with the external dongle bluetooth I used to use on my old Mac Pro (1,1), which would constantly drop the connection. But that was definitely the dongle's problem, and not the keyboard's.
customer_reviews.author: Crito

customer_reviews.title: Solar Keyboard that Can Be Shared Among Devices
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this keyboard because I did not need to keep replacing batteries in it. I didn't even realize the ability to switch this keyboard from one device to another (among three user-programmed devices) at the touch of a button. This feature is huge. I can easily swap between my iPad, iMac and Apple TV without having to adjust the bluetooth settings over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: MD Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: This is the keyboard all Mac users have been waiting for!
customer_reviews.text: Within five minutes of taking this keyboard out of the box I had it paired with my iPad and both the Mac and Windows partitions on my Macbook Pro. I cannot imagine an easier keyboard to setup. I am typing this review on the keyboard and really enjoy the touch sensitivity of the keys. Better than most keyboards I've used. I hope it lasts a long time, because I'm looking forward to no longer relying on batteries for my keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Never worked properly
customer_reviews.text: Not at all happy with this keyboard. After pairing it, it would often lose connection, and it would take several hours to reconnect. The item was just faulty. Not happy with it all. I would not recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Bluetooth Keyboard For Multiple Bluetooth Enabled Devices.
customer_reviews.text: Very good compact keyboard that works well with multiple bluetooth capable devices. Pros: 1) Works right out of the box. 2) Works between multiple devices (MacBook Air, iPhone and iPad in the this case) with a push of a button. 3) No batteries required. 4) Fits stylistically in with Mac devices quite well. [Relatively Minor] Cons: 1) Squishy keys similar to standard Mac keyboards...but not quite exactly right. 2) Plasticky build quality. 3) Not backlit. 4). Odd "Caps Lock" mode where key only lights up for a few seconds. A good deal, especially when paired w/ my v470 bluetooth mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hsia

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard, time will tell on the battery
customer_reviews.text: The logitech k760 pairs easily with both mac and iphone/ipad. The 3 device memory is very convenient for switching between mac and ipad. The keyboard has been charging and working off of solar for the past 3 weeks now but I still worry about the battery giving out in a year or so. For now though, this keyboard feels great and is very convenient. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: CookieMonster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Just used it for 4 days and the keyboard works amazingly well with my Macbook Pro (13'' Retina display). It took me just less than 1 minute to set up the connection by following the user manual. The connection is really reliable, have never experienced any interruption. The feeling while typing on this keyboard is also good, doesn't feel cheap at all. Great product with a reasonable price, I would recommend it to everybody.
customer_reviews.author: Tuan Dao

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Though I like the keyboard that comes with the iPad, it's also probably the reason I don't use it as much as I could because the of keyboard isn't the same as the QWERTY keyboard. Along comes this very wonderful keyboard from Logitech. It works exactly as advertised. I love the fact that I can use it with my Mac, iPhone, and iPad all at the push of a button. And on top of that, it's solar powered as well. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Paul E Clawson

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. As the others will mention, the keylock light won't remain on and sometimes it will lose the pair signal, but it quickly regains the signal so I don't think these two problems are a serious issue. I almost always get people coming to me to talk about the keyboard. Battery life is great and charging is a no brainier (just have it out to charge). The only true faults I have with this is 1) any kind of moisture will short it (I've lost two other keyboards because some coffee got onto the keys) and 2) Logitech no longer makes this item.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, with only one exception - it disconnects, quite a lot. I know that's a battery save feature, but I kinda wish I could set it to disconnect on my own time frame. I also wish that it had a USB plug so that I could charge it manually, even though I appreciate and love it's solar powered, I'd still like a backup in case the solar panels get damaged or something. But other than that, it's a great keyboard for my MBP.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: No changing batteries and easy swapping.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. It doesn't have the feel of mechanical keyboards but the other features make it a better choice for me. Not needing to charge and swap batteries is a huge plus for me. I don't like having to worry about replacing batteries. Also, I like being able to swap between my phone, computer and tablet without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Chang

customer_reviews.title: Wow the picture online and actual visual physical a bit difference.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know it is a bit bigger then the picture online showed. However, I think I'd use it frequently especially now I use it awhile I type this comment! It is really ease and comfortable. I believe the K760 keyboard is eco-friendly since it is save from plug and recharges, I know the weather isn't always perfect, but most of time, they do sunshine! Will charge it awhile it runs or not. I'm enjoying this one more.
customer_reviews.author: David D Long

customer_reviews.title: a+
customer_reviews.text: Even better feel than the apple keyboard. More spring in the keys. Keys are spaced a little farther apart- so good for people with bigger hands. Could do without the blue tooth device switches occupying the F1-F3 keys but that's a small nuisance. A must for mac users who wish to replace their standard battery-draining wireless keyboard. Now just need a solar powered mouse!
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. Connected fairly quickly to my Mac Mini! Very sleek and modern looking. Barely have to touch the keys when typing. Very responsive. Took a couple days longer to get it than i believe it should have but it was worth the wait! Thank-you Logitech. Only thing i was a bit irritated about was that the day i received it i notice that price came down $10. Other than that i would recommend it to anyone who has a Mac!
customer_reviews.author: randy johnson

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good, but one major flaw
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard overall, and I have 2. But a MAJOR flaw to me is the fact that I noticed was that the caps lock light doesn't stay lit when you click it. When you turn caps lock on it will light up for 2 seconds and then turn back off. This is a big issue for me. Very inconvenient....I'd return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Beagulz

customer_reviews.title: Not Just for Mac/iPaad/Phone
customer_reviews.text: As a writer, I travel a lot to conduct research. Laptops are a necessity, but bulky. I acquired a Samsung Chromebook which meets my needs very well, but wanted an external keyboard that was equally compact. The Logitech K760 meets that requirement and it does work with the Samsung very nicely. It also connects to the my Nexus 7 which I also use to draft or edit manuscripts to speed typing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to connect with OS X every time I log in.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard takes 10-20 seconds to be recognized by OS X at login. What a tremendous waste of time, and very frustrating. Totally not worth the convenience of being wireless.
customer_reviews.author: --Jason--

customer_reviews.title: No need for batteries make this keyboard easy to use and cost-effective
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good Bluetooth keyboard. I really like the solar feature which negates the need for batteries. The only real negative is that every so often it disconnects from my iPad Air on its own. Reconnecting is easily done though. It's only a matter of pressing the key you assigned to the device (you can pair this with 3 different devices) until it reconnects with said device.
customer_reviews.author: HarryWarden

customer_reviews.title: A Solar Keyboard? For Reals??
customer_reviews.text: YES!!!!! And guess what!? It totally works and it's totally awesome. It tethers perfectly with my Macbook Pro and my iPad. I love the numbered BT keys for quick-switching of devices. This is a really fantastic keyboard. I am dinging -one star because the key action definitely isn't as good as the Apple keyboards, it's loud and spongier. Also, it'd be awesome if they had a "pro" version that had a numbered keypad. That said, all in all, this is a really great keyboard that has saved me a ton of batteries. If you hate batteries as much as I do, GET THIS.
customer_reviews.author: nokapixel

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This keyboard is a great replacement. My kids use this with a Mac Mini, and it's much more comfortable and of higher quality than the stock Apple keyboard. The solar feature is nifty and is something you would expect from Apple. Setup was easy and it has been a reliable performer. I want to get another one for my Mac Pro now.
customer_reviews.author: AJD

customer_reviews.title: Never connected easily to my iMAC
customer_reviews.text: Never connected easily to my iMAC. It often took 10+ tries to force the keyboard's Bluetooth to see the computer. Finally I gave up and put it on the shelf. Went back a MAC keyboard. Too bad, because I really liked the idea of the solar powered keyboard and Logitech is a good brand.
customer_reviews.author: VeryHappy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard!!!
customer_reviews.text: This an excellent keyboard for the iPad Pro, and is a much better setup when paired with a hard beetle type case for the iPad itself. Much easier to switch from using the iPad as typing platform, or as a conventional tablet, than Apple’s own Smart Keyboard unit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: NIce keyboard in many respects: matches my iMac's look, has great feel when typing, keeps charged although I don't have it in direct light, and can be paired with three devices so I can easily use with iPad, etc. Holds connection well. Only negative is it takes a couple seconds to "wake up" after being idle for a long time - that's probably more a testament to my impatience than anything else.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Nice standards-compliant keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has a good feel and is easy to pair and use with multiple devices. That it's bluetooth instead of something proprietary (which really isn't an option for iPhones/iPads anyway) is great. That it won't ever need batteries or a charger is a huge timesaver. I'm very pleased with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner Stallion

customer_reviews.title: IMPORTANT: Software support for this product is crappy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and realized that Cmd-shift-tab interrupts Cmd-tab. In other words, when switching between windows, you can only go in one direction. Toggling the shift key causes an interruption and breaks out of the application switcher resulting in a very frustrating user experience. Logitech has been made aware of this problem more than 8 months ago but they have so far not provided any solution. The link to the forum is right below. You would expect them to fix this software issue, but they have turned a blind eye to it. [...]
customer_reviews.author: pmg

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Apple Aluminum Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My aluminum mac one fell off my desk and landed at an odd angle and the power button was forced into the on position, so it ate batteries like crazy. Once I saw a solar option was available, I didn't hesitate to grab one. Seriously these are great. Buy it used or refurbished if you can't afford a new one, its seriously perfect.
customer_reviews.author: photolinger

customer_reviews.title: Love it still after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I have never charged this ever, and it worked right out of the box. It doesn't even sit in front of a window or anything. Quick change to my iMac, Apple TV and iPad. I bought one for work too. I HIGHLY recommend this keyboard if you are tired of swapping batteries on your keyboard, or if you want to occasionally use a keyboard with an iPad or AppleTV.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Adams

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price With a Few Caveats
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of replacing batteries. This is just what I needed. -1 star for the funky layout. Have to reach a little bit on the enter button and a few others. The solar and quick connect are brilliant and work flalwlessly. A little bit pricey, but it's portable and you don't need batteries. What more do you want?
customer_reviews.author: B review

customer_reviews.title: I laugh at the pleb who still use their fingers hitting the screen to type lol
customer_reviews.text: Writing the review on the aforementioned keyboard, I am liking it more than my PC Logitech gaming keyboard. Get a good protective cover just in case the keyboard leaves your desktop and goes with you on a travel
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for my iPad
customer_reviews.text: It is a great keyboard for my iPad. I can easily type and send me emails without bring my heavy laptop during traveling. It recognize very fast. The cool thing is that it can switch conniptions to my wife's iPad and my iPhone very quickly. Up to three connections. I guess the most important thing is that you don't need to worry about the power at all. I just wonder how long the solar battery can last. At least, now I enjoy using it!
customer_reviews.author: stupidphd

customer_reviews.title: It works well. Keys a little too compressed for my liking but not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.text: It works well. I like that it's solar powered. I find the keys slightly too compressed for comfort, resulting in more typos than normal. The response time a little sluggish but that might be all bluetooth keyboards, I'm not sure. One cool thing is that you can pair it with several devices so it works with both my phone and tablet. It's a life saver when I have to type more than a few sentences on my smart phone or tablet. And I was able to type non-stop on a recent trans-atlantic flight without it losing its juice.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Easy typing, but often disconnects
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Easy feel of typing on this keyboard - No fuss wireless, easily powered by solar or other light - Lightweight Cons - Often disconnects (not sure if wireless mouse interferes) - A little slow to connect to computer when logging on and to internet when opening (just a few seconds, but noticeable) - Bluetooth button is placed on bottom surface close to right edge, so I have sometimes accidentally turned it off while holding the keyboard - Loss of additional USB ports that were on previous Mac keyboard But overall, this is an enjoyable improvement over the Mac keyboard with wires.
customer_reviews.author: SanRin

customer_reviews.title: great and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife, then bought another for my mother. The keyboard is well constructed, and the action is nice. Best features are that it is solar, so you don't have to change batteries all the time, and it will connect to up to 3 devices, so you can use it with your iPad and your computer without turning one off when you want to use the other. Just toggle devices with a keystroke. The only drawback I can see is that the solar panel makes it a little bigger than it would be otherwise, but for a full-sized keyboard (not cramped for typing), it's not too big, and it's very light and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Dunkelberg

customer_reviews.title: ... generously giving it a second star because it was nice while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I'm generously giving it a second star because it was nice while it lasted. But it lasted less than two years and one month of not particularly intensive use before several of the keys stopped working. They weren't damaged externally, the keyboard didn't fall, they just stopped working one day. That's not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Saskal

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is... ugh.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard seemed fine at first. The multi-device pairing was the best part for sure. The solar charging was really helpful. The functionality with my Apple TV was great, the iOS home button works to go home on the Apple TV. The cons would be the fact that it lacks a backlight and was really a desk hog (big). I broke it myself just 2 weeks after getting it, but it was completely my fault. If you need a bluetooth keyboard quick and on a budget (especially for any Apple devices, including the Apple TV), this is a pretty good option but I would also look at Logitech's newer options.
customer_reviews.author: Matt
